Dua Jurnalis Tewas di Labuhanbatu, Polisi Didesak Usut Tuntas
02 Nov 2019, 18:50 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi. (Foto: Istockphoto/ South_agency)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Dua wartawan tewas dengan kondisi mengenaskan di selokan areal perkebunan kelapa sawit PT SAB/KSU Amelia, Desa Wonosari, Kecamatan Panai Hilir, Kabupaten Labuhanbatu, Sumatera Utara. Kedua wartawan itu bernama Maraden Sianipar (55) dan Martua Siregar (42). Dosen Fakultas Hukum Universitas Sumatera Utara (USU) Syafaruddin Kalo mendesak Kepolisian Resor Labuhanbatu segera mengungkap kasus tewasnya dua wartawan tersebut. Ia menduga kedua wartawan itu sengaja dibunuh terkait masalah pemberitaan. "Hal itu perlu ditangani serius dan polisi segera menangkap otak pelaku pembunuhan tersebut," ujar Syafaruddin seperti dikutip dari Antara, Sabtu (2/11). Maraden dan Martua ditemukan tewas dengan luka sabetan senjata tajam di kepala, badan, lengan, punggung, dada, dan perut. Keduanya ditemukan dalam waktu yang berbeda. Maraden pada Rabu (30/10) pukul 16.00 WIB, sedangkan Maratua ditemukan keesokan harinya, Kamis (31/10) pada pukul 10.30 WIB. Syafaruddin menuturkan polisi harus segera menangkap dan memproses pelaku pembunuhan terhadap kedua wartawan tersebut."Menghilangkan nyawa orang lain dengan secara disengaja itu, tidak boleh dibiarkan dan harus diusut tuntas," katanya. (psp/wis)

Two Journalists Killed in Labuhanbatu, Police Urged to Accomplish Completely
02 Nov 2019, 18:50 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration. (Photo: Istockphoto / South_agency)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Two journalists were killed in appalling conditions in the ditch area of the PT SAB / KSU Amelia oil palm plantation, Wonosari Village, Panai Hilir District, Labuhanbatu Regency, North Sumatra. The two journalists were named Maraden Sianipar (55) and Martua Siregar (42). Lecturer at the Faculty of Law, University of North Sumatra (USU) Syafaruddin Kalo urged the Labuhanbatu District Police to immediately reveal the case of the death of the two journalists. He suspects the two journalists were deliberately killed related to the news issue. "It needs to be handled seriously and the police immediately catch the brain of the perpetrators of the killings," Syafaruddin said as quoted by Antara on Saturday (2/11). Maraden and Martua were found dead with sharp gun wounds on the head, body, arms, back, chest, and stomach. Both are found in different times. Maraden on Wednesday (10/30) at 16.00 West Indonesia Time, while Maratua was found the next day, Thursday (10/31) at 10:30 West Indonesia Time. Syafaruddin said that the police must immediately arrest and process the perpetrators of the murder of the two journalists. "The intentional elimination of the lives of others must not be allowed and must be investigated thoroughly," he said. (psp / wis)
